course.subject: SBMT
course.name: Social Enterprise Internship Program
course.description: The course is intended to give business undergraduate students an opportunity to gain exposure in the area of social entrepreneurship and apply their knowledge to solve real-world challenges facing these organizations. It is conducted in the form of an internship program at a designated social enterprise under the supervision of the School of Business and Management. Approval from the course coordinator is needed prior to enrolling in the course. Graded P or F. Students may repeat the course for credits if different topics are taken.

reviews.author: mman1
reviews.title: good first intership for freshman
reviews.comment_content: will be assigned to one of 15 NGOs/ SEs from many different backgrounds. good to read through every choices available and rank the choices accordingly.
reviews.comment_teaching: the coordinate is a very nice staff from SBM and he constantly look for the students under the program and ask if he/ she is doing ok in the intern job. if there were any unexpected/ unreasonable requests from the company he will step in and coordinates very well. the staff also gave some sessions before and after the internship and explain things very well.
reviews.comment_grading: just perform decently and you will get a good review from the
reviews.comment_workload: 160 hours in total within the 4 weeks winter semester. quite demanding for someone with no work experience but was okay for me, considering that there were no studies to take care of at that period of time.
